content: Congressional Democrats condemn Sean Spicer for Holocaust denial Spicer should get some history lessons, perhaps from the nearby Holocaust Museum. CREDIT: AP Photo/Alex Brandon During Tuesday’s press briefing, White House Press Secretary falsely claimed that Adolf Hitler never used chemical weapons on his own people and, in subsequent clarifications, continued to insist that Syrian President Bashar al-Assad’s use of chemical weapons was somehow worse. Members of Congress, most of whom are spending their recesses engaged at home with constituents, soon started issuing responses to Spicer’s comments. Most condemned the remarks and suggested Spicer needed some history lessons, perhaps from the United States Holocaust Museum, which is located just a few blocks from the White House. *Lawmakers marked with an asterisk have called for Spicer to lose his job.
